creator: pavankch@gmail.com
text:
CSV Data Set Config accepts only absolute paths for Filename field in Remote distributed testing.

I am running distributed testing with JMeter 2.5.1 version.
There are two JMeter servers. One is master and another is slave.
I am running test with generating load from both the servers. If I mention just the csv file name or relative file name, jmeter log displays file not found message.
If I use absolute path( full path of the file), it is working without any error.
I have the same directory structure in both the servers.

Servers configuration is 4 processor, 3 gb RAM and FEDORA LINUX (Fedora release 15 (Lovelock))

This problem exist in GUI mode only, if test is ran from terminal, it works fne.

creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
Relative paths DO work in GUI mode, but of course the starting directory is important.

Please provide full details from the client and server logs (in particular showing the directory settings).

Can you also provide the non-GUI logs?

Which directory are the files actually in?
creator: sebb@apache.org
pavankch@gmail.com
text:
Attached the client and server logs.
According to JMeter user manual, if csv data file is kept at test plan level, there is no need to mention the path.
I have tried with relative path also, but there is no use.

My test plan structure is as below

TestPlan
	TestPlan
		User Defined Variables
		HTTP Request Defaults
		Thread Group 1
			Include Controller( for TestFragment1)
		Thread Group 2
			Include Controller( for TestFragment2)
		Summary Report


TestFragment1
	Test Plan
		Test Fragment
			CSV Data Set Config(only mentioned file name)
			HTTP Cache Manager
			HTTP Cookie Manager
			LOGIN Once Only Controller
			Runtime Controller
			LOGOUT Once Only Controller


TestFragment2
	Test Plan
		Test Fragment
			CSV Data Set Config(only mentioned file name)
			HTTP Cache Manager
			HTTP Cookie Manager
			LOGIN Once Only Controller
			Runtime Controller
			LOGOUT Once Only Controller

are you asking jmeter logs for the test ran in non-GUI mode?

These log files are in the bin directory under Jmeter installation folder.
/home/tester1/jakarta-jmeter-2.5.1/bin

Jmeter and Script file paths:

jmeter installation path
	/home/tester1/jakarta-jmeter-2.5.1/bin
Script file and csv data files path
	/home/tester1/workspace/BCBSLA/ForMultiTestPlans
Running Jmeter from the below path

Relative paths used in all the places( for test plan, test fragment scripts and csv file)
	../../workspace/BCBSLA/ForMultiTestPlans/

With these settings, non-GUI mode testing is working fine, same is not working in GUI mode.
Will attach the log files for non-GUI mode in next comment.

text: When I was using relative paths in GUI mode, for CSV files, I didn't use any path, I just mentioned the file name.

Clarified documentation in 54097, it works as documented
